sidescroller.scene

Interface MapBuilderInterface


  • public interface MapBuilderInterface
    the purpose of this interface is to simply provide the method signatures.
    Version:
    Mar 19, 2020
    Author:
    Shahriar (Shawn) Emami

        set the canvas which this builder will use.

      • setGrid

        MapBuilderInterface setGrid(utility.Tuple rowColCount,
                            utility.Tuple dimension)
        set the number of rows and columns which will be in this application. plus the height and width of each cell.
        Parameters:
        rowColCount - - use Tuple::pair and pass max rows and counts
        dimension - - use Tuple::pair and pass width and height.
        Returns:
        the current instance of this object.

      • setGridScale

        MapBuilderInterface setGridScale(double scale)
        set the scale value for this builder. this scale will be used to multiply all widths and heights.
        Parameters:
        scale - - a double value
        Returns:
        the current instance of this object.

      • buildBackground

        MapBuilderInterface buildBackground(java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer,sidescroller.entity.sprite.tile.Tile> callback)

        build the background sprite.
        use SpriteFactory.get(String) and pass to it "Background". save in a BackgroundSprite variable.
        on the return call Sprite.init(double, Tuple, Tuple) and pass scale, dimension, and Tuple.pair( 0, 0).
        on the return call BackgroundSprite.createSnapshot(Canvas, Tuple, BiFunction) and pass canvas, rowColCount, and callback.
        use HitBox.build(double, double, double, double) and pass 0, 0, scale * dimension.x() * rowColCount.y(), and scale * dimension.y() * rowColCount.x().
        finally instantiate background using GenericEntity.GenericEntity(Sprite, HitBox).

        Parameters:
        callback - - a lambda which takes two arguments (row and col) and returns a Tile enum of type BackgroundTile. will be used to generate background.
        Returns:
        the current instance of this object.

      • buildLandMass

        MapBuilderInterface buildLandMass(int rowPos,
                                  int colPos,
                                  int rowConut,
                                  int colCount)

        build the background sprite.
        use SpriteFactory.get(String) and pass to it "Land". save in a LandSprite variable.
        on the return call Sprite.init(double, Tuple, Tuple) and pass scale, dimension, and Tuple.pair( colPos, rowPos).
        on the return call LandSprite.createSnapshot(Canvas, int, int) and pass canvas, rowConut, and colCount.
        use HitBox.build(double, double, double, double) and pass colPos * dimension.x() * scale, rowPos * dimension.y() * scale, scale * dimension.x() * colCount, and scale * dimension.y() * rowConut.
        finally add the instance of GenericEntity.GenericEntity(Sprite, HitBox) to landMass list.

        Parameters:
        rowPos - - first row from the top which the land will start.
        colPos - - first column from the left which the land will start.
        rowConut - - number of rows which the land mass will cover.
        colCount - - number of columns which the land mass will cover.
        Returns:
        the current instance of this object.

      • buildTree

        MapBuilderInterface buildTree(int rowPos,
                              int colPos,
                              sidescroller.entity.sprite.tile.Tile tile)

        build the background sprite.
        use SpriteFactory.get(String) and pass to it "Tree". save in a TreeSprite variable.
        on the return call Sprite.init(double, Tuple, Tuple) and pass scale, dimension, and Tuple.pair( colPos, rowPos).
        on the return call TreeSprite.createSnapshot(Canvas, Tile) and pass canvas and tile.
        by default there is no hitbox.
        finally add the instance of GenericEntity.GenericEntity(Sprite, HitBox) to other list.

        Parameters:
        rowPos - - first row from the top.
        colPos - - first column from the left.
        tile - - a tree type from enum FloraTile.
        Returns:
        the current instance of this object.

      • buildPlatform

        MapBuilderInterface buildPlatform(int rowPos,
                                  int colPos,
                                  int length,
                                  sidescroller.entity.sprite.tile.Tile tile)

        build the background sprite.
        use SpriteFactory.get(String) and pass to it "Platform". save in a PlatformSprite variable.
        on the return call Sprite.init(double, Tuple, Tuple) and pass scale, dimension, and Tuple.pair( colPos, rowPos).
        on the return call PlatformSprite.createSnapshot(Canvas, Tile, int) and pass canvas, tile, and length.
        use HitBox.build(double, double, double, double) and pass (colPos + .5) * dimension.x() * scale, rowPos * dimension.y() * scale, scale * dimension.x() * (length - 1), and scale * dimension.y() / 2.
        finally add the instance of GenericEntity.GenericEntity(Sprite, HitBox) to other list.

        Parameters:
        rowPos - - first row from the top.
        colPos - - first column from the left.
        length - - number of columns which the platform will stretch.
        tile - - a platform type from enum PlatformTile.
        Returns:
        this

      • getBackground

        sidescroller.entity.property.Entity getBackground()
        Returns:
        the background Entity.

      • getEntities

        java.util.List<sidescroller.entity.property.Entity> getEntities(java.util.List<sidescroller.entity.property.Entity> list)
        pass a list which will be populated by landmass first then other objects.
        Parameters:
        list - - a list to be populated by the created entities.
        Returns:
        the populated list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if list is null which means it was not initialized.
